texts.definition: Gameplay areas created for vehicular movement.
markups: Some games let players alternate between self-propelled movement and using vehicles. <style="CurrentLink">Vehicle Sections</style> are parts of game worlds specifically designed for the latter.

''The coast'' region in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Half-Life%202">Half-Life 2</link></style> in mainly an area meant to be traversed using a buggy. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Crysis">Crysis</link></style> has two parts of the game specifically designed to support travelling in vehicles - in one case in a main battle tank and in another a vertical takeoffs and landing aircraft. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Halo:%20Combat%20Evolved">Halo: Combat Evolved</link></style> and the other games in the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Halo%20series">Halo series</link></style> have several areas designed to using the ''Warthog'' and other vehicles.

Games with huge open worlds, e.g. the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Grand%20Theft%20Auto%20series">Grand Theft Auto series</link></style> and the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Battlefield%20series">Battlefield series</link></style> but also multiplayer maps in the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Halo%20series">Halo series</link></style>, can arguably be said to consist mainly of <style="CurrentLink">Vehicle Sections</style>. Building and narrow passages are here the exceptions the <style="CurrentLink">Vehicle Sections</style> and make pedestrian gameplay feasible.

Designing <style="CurrentLink">Vehicle Sections</style> is concerned with presenting players with a different scale between moving in <style="Link"><link="vehicles">Vehicles</link></style> and moving without them - games where one always is inside vehicles with the same capacities could be said to consist entirely of <style="CurrentLink">Vehicle Sections</style> but this also makes talking about the pattern superfluous.

<style="CurrentLink">Vehicle Sections</style> can be emphasized compare to other regions in several ways. One is simply to having entire <style="Link"><link="game-boards">Game Boards</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="levels">Levels</link></style> be <style="CurrentLink">Vehicle Sections</style> which are intermixed with other <style="Link"><link="game-boards">Game Boards</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="levels">Levels</link></style> (<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Crysis">Crysis</link></style> can be seen as an example of this). Another, exemplified by the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Battlefield%20series">Battlefield series</link></style> and the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Grand%20Theft%20Auto%20series">Grand Theft Auto series</link></style> from the third installment and forward, is to have most of a <style="Link"><link="levels">Level</link></style> be <style="CurrentLink">Vehicle Sections</style> but provide some places where pedestrian movement is required or those lacking <style="Link"><link="vehicles">Vehicles</link></style> can are not disadvantaged.

While <style="CurrentLink">Vehicle Sections</style> can make use of all types of game world features that other areas can use, it is worth pointing out that <style="Link"><link="obstacles">Obstacles</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="choke-points">Choke Points</link></style> can have more abrupt effects in <style="CurrentLink">Vehicle Sections</style> since players are likely to be moving at higher speeds.

Not too surprising, <style="CurrentLink">Vehicle Sections</style> are <style="Link"><link="transport-routes">Transport Routes</link></style> of <style="Link"><link="game-boards">Game Boards</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style>, or <style="Link"><link="levels">Levels</link></style> dedicated for using <style="Link"><link="vehicles">Vehicles</link></style>. They affect <style="Link"><link="movement">Movement</link></style>, and in many cases also <style="Link"><link="maneuvering">Maneuvering</link></style>, by letting players make explicit use of the capabilities of the <style="Link"><link="vehicles">Vehicles</link></style> provided. They can however cause <style="Link"><link="excise">Excise</link></style> if players intentionally or by mistake traverse them without the <style="Link"><link="vehicles">Vehicles</link></style>. In games that mix <style="CurrentLink">Vehicle Sections</style> with other sections within a continuous <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game World</link></style>, knowing where the boundaries between these are is a form of <style="Link"><link="strategic-knowledge">Strategic Knowledge</link></style>.

Since vehicular travel can be assumed to be quicker than "ordinary" travel, <style="CurrentLink">Vehicle Sections</style> can be seen as a halfway alternative between <style="Link"><link="quick-travel">Quick Travel</link></style> and ordinary <style="Link"><link="movement">Movement</link></style>.
